Reviews.Title: Great value, but with a flaw
Reviews.Author: Nicodimus
Reviews.Content: I am a novice at photography, so I will be writing this review from the perspective of someone who is not an expert at all with the ins and outs of using a camera. I just wanted something that took good quality pictures for this price range, was easy to use, and had a zoom. The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH5 was a massive upgrade from my old Kodak Easyshare C-530. When I took it out of the packaging, I was amazed at how small it was. I have big hands, but had no problem holding or operating the camera. The user manual is on a CD in .pdf format rather than being on paper, but this didn't bother me. The menus and buttons are fairly simple and easy to figure out. Novices like myself will have no trouble operating the camera after a little experimenting. FYI, there is no touch screen on this model, but a few simple buttons instead (which is exactly what I wanted. I suck at using touch screens because my big fingers lead to accuracy problems.) The 2.7 inch display makes it easy to see what you're doing. You can also customize a few items such as the focus icon, the LCD screen's brightness, what sounds the camera makes when taking a picture or selecting menu items, as well as the volume of each sound. If you want to take a self-portrait or family photo with yourself in it, there is a self-timer which can be set for a 2 or 10 second delay. The FH5 also has the standard tripod-mounting hole on the bottom.One of the really nice things this camera allows you to do is to take pictures with three different aspect ratios. Most of the options are 4:3, but you can also select 3:2 or my favorite, 16:9. Choosing the 16:9 setting means that your pictures display perfectly on a HDTV with no resizing required, which is perfect for me. I have found through experimentation that there are only really three different picture-taking modes that I need to use. The first is Scenery, for brightly lit pictures of outside landscapes. The second is Normal mode with Macro activated, for taking extreme close-ups of small objects/critters. For everything else, Intelligent Auto (iA) seems to do a fine job. I am generally quite pleased at the quality of pictures that this camera produces, and how simple it is to use. It does struggle with overblown bright sunlit areas, but so do all point-and-shoot cameras. The previously mentioned Scenery mode seems to handle these areas the best. I confess that someone who knows more about photography might be able to come up with manual settings that produce better results in this situation than I can. Before I bought a new camera, I was concerned that whichever one I got might have a delay between me pressing the button and it actually taking the picture, but there are no worries with the FH5. It's simply lightning-fast. I cannot comment on the ease or quality of video recording, as I have never used it.Overall, this camera does a great job for the low price (it was $119.00 when I purchased it.) However, there IS an elephant in the room that prevents the FH5 from getting 5 stars, and that is the poor battery life. I went on a hike yesterday that lasted 2.5 hours, and I took about 170 pictures. The camera went from being fully charged to being fully drained in this time. I already had both the LCD brightness and sound turned down to help save the battery as well. If you have the sounds and brightness set higher, the issue will be even worse. This might not be a big deal if you're just going to use the camera sporadically, but in some circumstances it might become a real problem. If you are on vacation, and you have a full day of photography planned, you'll need to get an extra battery or two. I timed it, and it takes about 100 minutes to fully recharge the battery, so at least that's fairly quick. I have not purchased an extra battery (which is damned expensive at $55.)What else will you need to get with this camera, if anything? Well, first of all it comes with a wrist strap, but I'd recommend getting a simple neck strap instead. It provides added security and it's just easier to carry something around your neck. The body of the camera is fairly smooth, and you don't want it slipping out of your hands and getting dropped. Another thing I would recommend is a simple case for protecting the camera when it's not in use. The rear LCD IS flush with the body of the camera, so you don't want to be setting it on anything that could scratch it. I got the Case Logic TBC-301, and it fits well. The camera comes with 70MB of on-board memory, so you'll definitely want to pick up a SD/SDHC card if you want to take more than a few pictures at once. I got an 8GB, 30MB/sec card for about $32. However, before it arrived, I used an older and slower 1GB, 15MB/sec card which seemed to work just fine. You can probably get a much cheaper card than I did and it will be good for general photography purposes. I went with this card because I felt I needed the fastest possible card for burst mode. Many times on my hikes, I come across wildlife unexpectedly and usually I only have a second or two before the critter is gone, and the faster your card is in this situation, the better.  If you plan on recording video, you may also want one of the faster cards. The last thing you will almost definitely want to grab (if you don't have one already) is a flexible mini-tripod, which are usually about 4 inches tall. I got one last year for my old Kodak, and it works great with both cameras.

Reviews.Title: better than I expected - UPDATE Dec. 2011
Reviews.Author: Jon Norris
Reviews.Content: I wanted to see how well this camera would actually function as a carry-around for quick grabs of interesting things which happen too fast to dig a camera out of a bag. Being very pocketable, it is easy to carry in shirt or pants pockets, provided you take into consideration the delicate nature of the LCD screen and thin lens cover.Anyone who reads my other reviews of cameras and electronics will know that I am no fan of proprietary rechargeable batteries. I think they are wasteful and unnecessary complications, requiring one to purchase extra batteries which can only be used on one device, then must be discarded. Given that we already have international standards for battery designs (including rechargeable), I find it a poor design choice created primarily to bilk customers out of more hard-earned cash.That said, I will have to admit that this camera has changed my mind a little in that regard. I am still using my very first charge on the included battery, and have not had to recharge it yet. Now, I only shoot it for limited periods of time, and not every day, but the charge is holding far better than I expected, even when not in use.Another strong point is that I can get extra batteries from a third party for little more than the price of a 4-pack of lithium AA batteries, which means that I can easily carry several charged batteries for about the same cost as one-use batteries. This makes it much more attractive, even though I am still limited to the charged batteries I have on hand. I have even bought 2 extra batteries to test this out. I will update if there are any significant additional things to report.The other thing that has made this camera far more attractive to me is its macro capability. As an old geezer with eyes not quite so good as in my youth, I find it more and more difficult to read the increasingly microscopic text being printed on increasingly smaller electronic devices, such as wall wart power supplies, and have found that this camera works extremely well for taking pictures in macro mode and zooming in to make them very readable. I have also used this camera to reach inside equipment racks to take pictures to document equipment connections (which were undocumented) before making changes or moving gear. It has worked very well for that.It has become my camera of choice for everyday carry-around use, and although it is not as easy to use as my favorite Canon 720 IS, I am finding that it functions reasonably well for most things. The lack of  an optical viewfinder makes it difficult for those of us with glasses, especially in the bright sunlight, but the LCD can be made bright enough to see well enough to frame shots with an acceptable level of usefulness. It would be better if the LCD were not glossy, however, as reflection in bright light makes it more difficult to use.The picture quality is good, although I haven't done any hard comparisons with my other cameras yet. I was shooting at the 5 megapixel size for a while to save space on the 1gb card, but have since replaced that with an 8gb card and will test at full resolution.All in all, I am happily surprised and looking to using and testing this camera more in the future. I will update with any significant information.Within its limitations, I would recommend this camera.UPDATE No. 13, 2011I used the video recording feature for the first time recently, and I was extremely impressed. The video was very clear and sharp, and the audio was amazing for the tiny mic placed on top of the camera.The more I use this camera, the more I like it. It has become very useful in my life.UPDATE: Dec. 17, 2011I have seen some references to Panasonic has changing their batteries in later models so one cannot use third party batteries, but must purchase the vastly more expensive Panasonic ones. If that is true, that makes this camera even more valuable, as one can still get replacement batteries from third parties. Shame on you Panasonic, if that is true.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: shari
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before leaving for a two-week trip to Kauai.  My other digital camera, a fancy Canon camera, broke a while back and I haven't had it fixed yet, plus it is huge.So I was looking for something relatively inexpensive that would take good quality photos and would not have unacceptable shutter lag.This camera fits the bill.  It's tiny but solid; very little shutter lag; has many interesting scene modes; captures colors really well; and it's extremely easy to transfer files from the camera to a computer without using any special software.I was a little bit worried about the lack of control due to the complete point and shoot nature of this camera, but I found that by using Intelligent Auto Mode, the results improved.  Intelligent Auto got it right most of the time.  The stabilization is great, too.  Then I found that I could make the camera do some other tricks that make it slightly more tailored to my needs - I found the setting that allows the camera to determine the optimal shutter speed and tweaked a few other settings.  Now it takes awesome low-light photos (pending you can hold the camera still for up to 1/4 of a second).  I took photos inside of a lava tunnel with no flash and they came out!The battery life is good also, which I was concerned about.  I could take well over 100 photos a day (leaving the camera on for long periods of time) and only wear out 1/3 of the battery.

Reviews.Title: Does what I need
Reviews.Author: Anton Giroux "tgiro"
Reviews.Content: My knowledge of cameras and photography is somewhat less than my knowledge of quantum physics. All the details of pixels, noise, shutter, low-light, etc, get my standard response of "Um, yeah, Ok!"I need a camera that I can turn on, aim it at someone/thing, push the button halfway to focus and the rest of the way to take the picture.  And - Oh by the way, I'm a shaky guy, so the camera needs to be smart enough to account for that.After this amazing feat, I hope to see a picture, sharp enough to tell who or what I'm taking a picture of.  This camera fully exceeds this goal.The only gripe I have is that the buttons are small and to close together for my fat fingers, but I blame this mostly on my fat fingers.I'm a Happy Guy.

Reviews.Title: Practical and delivers high quality pictures... exactly what I needed!
Reviews.Author: R.Suarez "R-Suarez-"
Reviews.Content: I have used for years now a Sony DSC-H2, throughout the years I have refused to change it, even for the newer Sony models that followed that one because of the quality of the pictures, the colors and some functionalities that got lost in newer models. My wife however, a more practical person and worried about the camera being impractical because of its size, always wanted a smaller camera she could carry in her bag not as bulky as my beloved Sony.So I was offered the opportunity to test and review this camera and could not say no, it had great reviews, it was small and with 16.1 MP I assumed picture quality should be acceptable. So far I love it!I have been heavily using this and it has fulfilled all my expectations, among the many features it has, you can take pictures in HDTV format (widescreen) which is a big deal to me as my photo albums are stored on my PS3 to be watched in my HDTV. The amount of detail that this model delivers is fantastic, I really see a difference between the pictures taken with this one against the ones from my Sony DSC which has a lower MP rate. The colors are vibrant and very close to the actual ones, opposite to the colors displayed by my reference camera, I can see colors are a little bit downgraded but nothing to be too worried about. I liked the fact that this camera does not have the average wheel for you to select the scene mode, instead, there is a mode button that displays up to 28 different scene options! (I included some reference pictures of this if you're interested in more details)It has taken some time to get used to it since I was always carrying the bigger case to parties or places we visited were we would like to take some pictures, this is so small that I can actually carry it without a case! It is smaller in size than an iPhone but a little bit thicker though, again, I added some size reference pictures for those interested. So now I am finding myself taking pictures of things or events I did not before, because it is now easier to carry the camera with me, and the most important thing, I don't have to worry about the pictures being of a lesser quality as quality is as good as the one I am used to!Important to note that to fully enjoy this camera you need to buy the memory card separately, as with most cameras, the memory included is internal and of course the amount of pictures you can take will be very limited depending on the quality selected.Video also provides very good quality, but, as any video recording device of this kind (like the Sony Bloggie or the FlipHD), quality will suffer depending on lighting conditions, a sunny day will deliver vibrant colors and a great amount of detail while interiors lit by your average light bulb will be recorded without as many detail as a well lit place. This is not a bad thing about this model but what I consider normal behavior in this type of devices, worth mentioning though.The box includes the USB cable, video cables to output to a TV set and a rechargeable battery with its respective charger (which at first I thought was not the best option as I would like to carry extra batteries in case the one included runs out, battery life though, has proven to be great and have not had any problems with running out of battery while taking pictures or recording video)I cannot comment on the software included as it has always been easier for me to use the windows default application to copy the contents of the memory card directly to my external HD.Bottom line, this camera has proven to be great and more than expected, if you, like me, need a camera that's easy to carry for those parties, events or just occasional pictures with great picture quality, this one's definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: FAST,EASY, AND GREAT PIC QUALITY
Reviews.Author: collegefresh
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera because i needed a small, compact camera that was easy to use and didn't take a million years to take a pic that usually ended up blurry on my other cameras. Anyways, i got it the day before i went to Vans 2011 Warped Tour with all my favorite bands. The battery lasted all day!! The pic & video quality are absolutely amazing! i was jumping up & down,dancing around and being smooshed by hundreds of people while taking videos & pics of all the bands and lets just say, the pictures are perfect & best of all....NON BLURRY!!! thank you jesus! haha. Well, overall this camera is really light, fast, & the best buy i ever made electronics wise. i just hope it lasts!!P.S. The Amazon Vine Program reviews really helped and are what finalized my decision to buy this camera. THANK YOU AMAZON VINE REVIEWERS & AMAZON for helping me make a smart & unregrettable buy. :) I am in love with this camera & to all future college students or teens.....this camera can last through anything and is perfect for vacations or parties. :)

Reviews.Title: buy and shoot
Reviews.Author: morning fog
Reviews.Content: My last point and shoot was canon s70. It's not that old and it shoots raw, but, compared to this Panasonic one, my Canon felt like an ancient device. First, I was impressed with its compact size. I can not believe how far technology has come since my Canon point and shoot. This camera is very small and light; it is easy to  carry on anywhere.Featurewise, considering this is a compact point and shoot, I do not expect dslr quality pictures, yet it is great that this has an optical image stabilizer and 4x zoom. In the low light setting, of course, the pictures are noisy with the high ISO, but the optical IS helps a little bit to get the sharper (or not too shaky) images. Also, 4x optical zoom is very nice feature. Often camera manufacturers tend to advertise greatly about their 10x 20x digital zoom, but it is only a matter of time for people to realize that digital zoom equals to terrible image quality.I have not touched compact point and shoot cameras since the iPhone era, and I believe now that I was the only one who thought taking photos on the iPhone was the most convenient option for me. It was a habit I suppose, to omly use my iPhone for photos, because I could easily upload pictures without downloading to my computer. However, iPhone camera is not yet point and shoot replacement 100%, maybe 80%. iPhone cameras might have more soft feature options in terms of many different camera related apps, but hardware wise, the iPhone cannot beat this one. This camera is tiny enough to carry with my iPhone in the purse or pocket, and it does more than an iPhone does. Also, the image and video quality is better than my iPhone 4's.I have not tried printing 16x20 printing with this yet; I should not have any problem printing that big out of 16 megapixel camera, however.These days micro four thirds are receiving popularity, but the price is stiff and it is still compact camera with smaller sensor than dslrs'. I thought about getting GF2, but I became hesitant easily because of the $600 price tag. However, I do not mind sacrifycing the bigger sensor and great depth of field for more than $400. I tried GF1 in a low light setting, and it was still noticeably noisy and slow to focus.So, if you just need a simple, tiny, and light point and shoot that does its job more than an average point and shoot, I recommend this one. If you are disappointed by slow focus and shutter lag or lack of flash or any machanical  presets, I also recommend this camera.Overall, I am truly satisfied with this camera, but wished it cames with at least 2gb sd card.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Strategos "The Guardian of Time"
Reviews.Content: I you are are a novice with digital cameras/taking pictures, or want a camera where you can literally just point and shoot this is the device for you. it's small, easy to hold, has a nice big clear digital viewfinder, relatively fast delay between shots and actual shot time, and is REALLY easy to use. In fact, this is without a doubt the easiest camera to use I have ever seen in my life.To be sure, you can select custom scene modes for specialized shots, but most of the time the pictures taken by the camera in it's fully automatic default are just fine. It has image stabilization, a very nice zoom (very good for wildlife pictures), and automatically detects when flash is needed. Pretty much every other function that helps ordinary people take great pictures is built-in, from focus-lock to facial detection.There is a tiny amount of built-in memory, but with memory prices being what they are you might as well grab a 4GB memory card or two. Personally I have no need to use the highest megapixel setting (What am I gonna do? Print out posters?) and instead set the resolution a bit lower so I can take HUNDREDS of pictures on a single 4GB memory card.Two things to note: Seniors and those with poor eyesight may have trouble seeing the image on the screen on the viewfinder in bright sunlight with high glare (my mother could not see the screen on cameras like this to take a picture no matter how many times I explained, showed her, and tried to help her). Also, digital screen viewfinders have ALWAYS been battery hogs. If you leave the camera on between shots you will probably only get around 2 hours as the manufacturer has said. If, on the other hand, you turn off the camera between your series of shots (take a few shots, turn off camera, find another good view, turn on camera, take a few more) the battery will last MUCH longer. If you desire to use the camera for extended periods of time I would buy another spare battery pack to increase shooting time. Personally, I wish ALL digital cameras also had a regular viewfinder and the ability to switch off the digital one to save the battery.I already have a Cannon PowerShot A480 which is a more full-featured regular-size that also does good point-and-shoot but it's nice to have this camera for either my own use when I want something I can easily slip in my pocket, or let someone else with less gadget experience literally turn it on, point, and shoot. I plan on taking a trip to Disney World in September with my wife and will use the Cannon myself and let her use the point-and-shoot. It will be interesting to see who gets more good pictures...If you want a truly easy to use point and shoot camera and can live with the viewfinder and short battery life if you don't turn it off between shots, this is the camera for you. It's a lot of camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Alice in Wonderland
Reviews.Content: I am not a digital camera expert...admittedly I am being dragged kicking and screaming into the digital revolution. When I pick up a camera, I expect to be able to point and shoot, with no hassles and no complications. Well, this camera definitely works for me!For the beginner, the camera is easy to work with, taking excellent pictures that are easy to download to your laptop. The battery life is quite good, allowing me to carry the camera around all day and use it as the spirit took me - though I was careful to turn it off when I finished taking pictures.So, as an amateur photographer (VERY amateur) I must say that I was very pleased. This is now my camera for vacations and whatnot, and I am very glad to have it.(Review of Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH5 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD)

Reviews.Title: Grainy photos, I'm sending it back :(
Reviews.Author: Paula fitz
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera from a big box store after reading all the reviews here on Amazon.  I'm disappointed that the 16mp do not come close to the 10mp Norcent camera I had prior to this one. I've only had this model a few days and I am not happy with how grainy the pictures come out. When blowing up a photo, you'd think 16mp would keep the image crisp and sharp, not so with this camera. Everything had a bad grainy appearance to it, and I did try many different settings. Also disappointed that I cannot use the Macro setting unless its on "normal" mode. So what that means is all those "cool" scene modes will not allow Macro to work.  I did have the image stabilizer engaged, while it did help ensure photos were not blurry (in most settings, cannot use it on High Dynamic scene mode) it does not matter overall if the entire image looks dull.  So glad I didn't go with the pricier, very similar Panasonic model I was looking at because if I had spent more money and had these results, I'd be very upset.  The camera is going back to the store!

Reviews.Title: Field Tested and Approved
Reviews.Author: Sam Sattler
Reviews.Content: I purposely held back on commenting about the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH5 until after my annual road trip to Kentucky to attend a three-day music festival there.  Honestly, this is the type of photography I do most these days, and any camera that failed to satisfy me under those conditions (heat, humidity, rain, wind, etc.) would quickly be set aside for something better.I am happy to report that the Panasonic Lumix pretty much passed the test with flying colors.  Of course, as is most common these days, the camera does not come with printed owner's manual - meaning that I had to wing it while at the concerts all those hours - no PC available when help was needed, that's for sure.  That said, I found the buttons and controls to be fairly intuitive, and had little trouble in getting the camera to do what I wanted it to do.  About the only problem I had with it was figuring out how to playback a couple of video clips I shot for test purposes.  But even that, I eventually worked out.I shot most of my photos in "Intelligent Auto" mode and never did see a need to override that setting - although I tinkered with some of the other preset "scenes" settings just to see what they could do.  I never did find (and it could very well be my fault) a setting that took good pictures after the sun was completely down and the pinkish stage lighting dominated the bands.  Frankly, however, I've not found any other "point and shoot" camera that does it any better than the Lumix.  That is a weakness of all but the more expensive cameras and lenses, I assume.Battery life was more than adequate for me.  I was generally at the event by noon each day and did not leave until near midnight.  By turning the camera completely off between my bursts of picture-taking, I was easily able to make the battery last that whole time - recharging overnight, for the next day.I am particularly impressed by the slimness of the camera and the fact that it weighs little enough that I can comfortably carry it in a shirt pocket for hours at a time.  I have not purchased a case for it but am considering that since the preview screen/viewfinder sits so flush with the back side of the camera that it can be easily scratched - although, amazingly enough that did not happen once during my three days at this outdoor festival or during the days of traveling to and from KY.  The screen 'seems' to be fairly scratch resistent, but I'm just guessing on that based on my personal experience.The 8X zoom is adequate for most purposes but, because of the camera's 16 mega pixel standard, I found myself shooting with less zoom, with the intention of cropping and "blowing up" the photos with editing software.  That worked out well.Overall, I think this is a good camera for the price and I am happy with the end products, the photos...that's what really counts.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: H. Erickson-Sander "Heather"
Reviews.Content: After getting my new Nikon DSLR in January I completely forgot how nice a little point & shoot can be, too. Especially with kids and being on-the-go all the time! While I love bringing my DSLR along to take great pictures with, I don't always want to carry the bulky thing around. I'm a blogger who is always finding spontaneous photo opportunities, but picture quality is hugely important to me. I feel like with this Panasonic I can still get great pictures when I really need to, even with a tiny point & shoot camera.One of my favorite features is all the scene modes - I love using these in the first place, but Panasonic has added info that scrolls across the screen for each scene mode icon - telling you what scene mode to use and when. Then there's also the "intelligent auto" mode for those moments where you want to snap a picture quickly but don't have time to set up a mode or pick your settings. This camera also has more scene mode options than I've ever seen on a camera before - including one for taking pictures of food, and two for taking photos of babies!This camera takes very nice photos, at 16-megapixil resolution it's a pretty powerful small camera (this camera is definitely small). One of my biggest pet peeves with small cameras is the shutter delay. Especially as a parent, when I want to snap a picture I want it to take NOW. This camera has a very fast shutter, slowed every so slightly when using flash, but still very fast and snappy.It's incredibly simple to use, a "minimalist" camera, if you will, when compared to my huge Nikon with all the complicated settings. This camera is a breath of fresh air in it's simplicity. All the main buttons are right there, ready to use. If you've used any digital camera with ease in the past, this one will be easy to learn. I hate when I have to scroll through 3 different screens just to delete one photo. I have previously owned a Nikon & Samsung point & shoot, as far as ease of use and picture quality go, this new Panasonic is my favorite.It's a great camera, I've been very happy with it. It could never replace my beloved Nikon DSLR, but it's such a nice addition to have because I'm always on the go with the kids, and I love to take pictures to blog for later. This is the next best thing when I can't lug my chunky Nikon along.

Reviews.Title: Good, Well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH5 16.1 Digital Camera was worth its price. I bought it for $98. It is very small and able to fit in my pocket easily. The camera takes pictures with super good quality. An SD card and a carrying case was not included in the package, but that was okay since I already had my own. I have heard from other reviews that said the camera had a Mega O.I.S error after a period of time. I haven't gotten that error yet, but I will inform you if I do.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: W. Panozzo "cooking mama"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I needed a new point and shoot. It is really easy to use and comes with a rechargable battery which is nice. it is pretty small and easy to transport. i am no expert by any means when it comes to a camera, but this is very easy to use and takes nice pictures. it is so easy, my 12 yr old is always 'borrowing" it. Guess what she is getting for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Camera and OIS error
Reviews.Author: D. Evans
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, June 11 of this year.  Basically, I had no issue with the camera until Christmas eve when the camera gave a message to turn the camera off.  From that point, I had an O.I.S. error and the camera kept shutting down.  I could take one picture before I had to shut it off again.  I did manage to get all of the pictures taken but it took some extra effort.  I called Panasonic and they told me to reset the camera, which did not solve the problem.  Now I am sending it off for repair which it is still under warranty.  If it was not I would just trash it.  I liked the camera but now I would wonder if the camera will still have the same problem in six months.  Appears after doing some searching on the internet that this error not only exists with this camera but with others as well.  I guess my recommendation is somewhat negative on the fact that this is my first digital camera to have issues.  It might just be one bad apple and I bought it.29 Dec - Shipped camera back for repair, will update when it is returned.

Reviews.Title: Simple, No Blur Pictures.
Reviews.Author: Sadie
Reviews.Content: This little compact digital camera packs a wallop in a slim shell.  These are the stats:* 4X zoom lens, extending to 9X.* Burst speed takes 2 pictures per second;* Hi-speed Burst takes 6 pictures per second.* Camera:  3 ¾" long, 2 ¼" high and ¾" wide.* LCD monitor: 1 7/8" x 2 3/8", and projects a vivid image.It comes with:* a battery* battery charger* hand strap* USB cable to connect to your computer or printer* AV cable to connect to your TV for video playback* Set-up manual* CD with the full instruction manual that you download onto your computer into a pdf file.Taking pictures is very simple:  While in Intelligent Auto Mode, press the shutter button half way to focus, wait for the green light, then press the shutter button down the entire way.  And, you have perfect pictures every time.With the Optical Image Stabilizer, there is no blurring at all.  I moved the camera slightly when taking a picture and it still came out blur free.  I have to hold my breath when using my Cannon digital camera so the images won't blur -  not so with the Lumix.Want to take a self-portrait?  There's a self time that will take the picture in either 2 seconds or 10 seconds.To record a motion picture video, press the shutter button half way to focus while in the Motion Picture Mode, then press it all the way to start recording.  To stop, press the shutter button again.  It's really that simple.It does not come with a memory card - be sure to get one.  There is memory on the camera, but I was only able to take 12 pictures before it was full.  I tried to insert the memory card from my Cannon, but it wouldn't fit.  It takes Class 6 or higher SD, SDHC or SDXC memory card.I'd also advise getting a case for it because the LCD monitor is exposed and can get scratched if you put this in a pocket or purse.I'm giving this only 4 stars because it does not come with a complete hard copy of the instruction manual.  If I want to look up a particular function, I need to turn on my computer and look at the pdf version.  It would have been very simple to include the manual as opposed to a CD.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY PANASONIC!
Reviews.Author: suzannell
Reviews.Content: I ordered a camera from them and it quickly had a system error and would not function. They sent a refurbished one, same error, and a another refurb, same error. Basically just sent junk refurbished items until it was out of warranty. Happened again when it was out of warranty by a couple of weeks and then said too bad despite the fact we'd only had the replacement for about two months. Horrible product, even worse customer service!

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, but mediocre in low light
Reviews.Author: TT
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a trip to Europe, where I spent a lot of time in castles and cathedrals.  Outdoors, the camera was great.  Indoors, especially in large rooms, the camera was not really satisfactory.  The shutter speed was too slow, and so most of the pictures were blurry.I also got the impression that the resolution of the camera was too high for its optics.  At large magnifications, even the best pictures showed some blurriness in the details.The camera also had a large number of presets for various conditions, but many of them were very similar to each other, and none seemed to be right for the conditions I needed at any given time.  I was overwhelmed by the options, so I didn't choose any of them.  I just kept the camera on Auto and tried my best to steady the camera.  The automatic stabilization feature did not appear to work for me.In summary, I got the impression that the camera was trying to compensate for poor performance by offering a lot of gimmicks.

Reviews.Title: Not very durable
Reviews.Author: Dan'l
Reviews.Content: This camera has fantastic features for its size and price point and takes wonderful photos but mine is already broken and needs to be repaired.  The entire mechanism for operating the zoom and shooting pictures disintegrated in my pocket and I could not get it back together. I found all the parts in my pocket but ultimately lost the tiny spring that is part of this mechanism. I actually have 2 of these cameras. My wife has not used hers much yet. We'll see how that goes. Based upon my experience, I would not buy another one.  My camera had only taken about 150 photos when it met its demise. Not a very good track record.

Reviews.Title: A Real Bargain
Reviews.Author: William A. Stephens
Reviews.Content: Having bigger, more advanced cameras (i.e., hard to carry around), I decided a smaller, lighter, cheaper point-and-shoot would be more practical (i.e., useable in most situations). Boy, was I right!What was unexpected, however, was the quality build and excellent output of this tiny device -- available at Fry's for considerably less than the price advertised at Amazon.com. While not as versatile as my Olympus DSLR, it does the job very well indeed. The controls are easily mastered, and they do provide ample opportunities to capture quite nice shots under varying indoor and outdoor conditions. Focus is very decent (AF assisted in appropriate situations, with the ability to turn flash off otherwise), with image-stabilization an added benefit. Aspect ratio can be set at 3:2, 4:3 or 16:9.Compared to my very first digital camera, a Casio purchased twelve years ago, this one has many more features -- including high def movie mode (at 720p, but without zoom in movie mode, alas!). The output is vastly superior to that long ago Casio. Even has 70Mb built-in memory, which I have augmented with two 8Gb Maxwell SDHC (10X) cards. Also includes a USB 2.0 cable, charger and battery (compare Canon 100 Powershot Elph, which includes none of the above accessories). I have also acquired two additional Wasabi batteries -- including charger, with car and international power plugs -- and case.All told, the price of the camera and additional goodies was about $150. That's about 10% of the price I paid 12 years ago for my Casio (including flash cards and batteries). And I have 10 times the camera.P.S. I gave this a 5-star rating not because it is comparable to a Nikon DSLR. It isn't. But for what it is, it is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic point and shoot for the price
Reviews.Author: Joshua Dodson "Happysack"
Reviews.Content: I didn't have my expectations to high on a 100 dollar point and shoot but with a kid on the way I wanted something cheap that I could capture memories with. Straight out of the box impressions are good so far, I started off testing high ISO shooting to see what kind of grain/distortions I would need to account for.Started testing at 1600, shots are pretty grainy nothing terrible though for its max ISO rating, with a sturdy hand the grain was noticeable but not so bad that I wouldn't use it if needed.ISO 800 is shooting well with minimal grain, ISOs between 100-600 are shooting great with little to no grain.The different modes they offer seem to work fine, I'm not much of a Point and shoot user I've always shot SLR and DSLR's but had to sell my gear last year so to switch to being limited on my settings can be a bit annoying for me I keep picking it up wanting to change my shutter spd and Fstop but not being able to control that is a bit of a bummer, getting used to auto focus is odd too I miss manual.That being said tweaking the settings the limited amount that I can I'm pulling great shots already off this camera, the image stabilization is great shooting at 1/8th in low light has been no problem.Colors are coming out great, not saturated at all, have experimented with Vivid and normal colors, vivid is pulling the colors out nicely.Highlights look very nice not overblown.My biggest complaint about this camera would be how small it is, this isn't really a problem in the camera itself though so I wouldn't discredit it at all for this, I have huge hands and I'm used to holding big cameras so it pick something up that's smaller than my phone to shoot with is a bit awkward to me.Over all for 100 dollars this was a fantastic deal, the shots come out nice, the colors rich, the video looks great, shoots well in higher iso, comes with a charger/battery don't have to buy AA's also a bonus!

Reviews.Title: PANISONIC LUMIX DMC-FH5 DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: glynda davis
Reviews.Content: I HAVE NO PHOTOGRAPHY EXPERIENCE BUT I AM NOW TAKING VERY GOOD PICTURES. IT IS EASY TO USE, THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE WELL WRITTEN AND UNDERSTANDABLE. I RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA TO ANYONE WHO WANTS TO TAKE GOOD QUALITY PICTURES.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: It is a nice camera. Its night view is beautiful. Pictures are crisp.When I use it in the night the pictures are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for a great price
Reviews.Author: truiiluv
Reviews.Content: This camera  has such clarity in the pics it takes. I bought it for my husband who is electronic challenged, he has had no problems figuring it out. I will be buying me one asap.

Reviews.Title: Not good with toddlers
Reviews.Author: Mia Nieves
Reviews.Content: I am no photographer, but I didn't want to lug around my Canon digital SLR or whatever the initials are at Disney World.  That one I had paid $1200 for so I just wanted a lighter camera, and Good Housekeeping raved about this.  However, I have a toddler so the camera is not good and too slow so most of the photos were blurry.  I am sure it's fine when you're taking a picture of an immobile statue, but not candid shots of people moving.  The video part was good though as I taped my kid dancing with characters at Disney World, so that's why I give this 3 stars.  I also have a big Sony video camera I paid for 3 years ago for $1000, but it's too bulky, but I will bring my Canon SLR and this camera to videotape on future vacations.

Reviews.Title: Not the easy point and shoot I expected
Reviews.Author: OICU812 "Details"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera nut - my wife wanted a good point and shoot camera that didn't require constant tweaking to settings.  I had high hopes - but this fell short.  We took this camera to Disney.  We took over 400 pictures - and maybe got 50 to 75 usable ones and those were all set in the daylight hours.  Anything at night looked horrible - basically grainy and unfocused.  I'm absolutely sure this had something to do with my wife an I just not fully understanding the settings - but that's why I thought it had the IA function <-- for people like us! The IA function failed my family miserably.  My take away - if you're looking for a good point and shoot that you turn on - snap photo's and put away - look elsewhere.  If you're good at manipulating the camera functions - this camera may work for you.  The daylight photos we did take were stunning.

Reviews.Title: Very compact and feature-loaded at a good price
Reviews.Author: plyopowerd "Arrow Dynamic Mom"
Reviews.Content: I'd never had a Panasonic camera before, and I didn't usually think of them in connection with cameras, but I will now.  This Lumix is very easy to set up, with lots of features like burst mode, panoramic, "slimming" mode, picture frames and much more.  Quick one-touch adjustments and a quick menu let you make adjustments like turn on the timer, view photos and videos or switch between picture sizes without wading through tons of menus - once you learn the controls by reading the extended user manual on the enclosed CD.Four stars because I wish this camera was a little more ergonomic.  The rectangular shape and lack of a hand grip on the side, make it difficult to grasp and operate with one hand.  There's no reason for a digital camera to be "camera-shaped", anyway - they ought to be more like video game controllers or vertically-oriented so left-handed people can handle them just as well.  But this is still a nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: A nice little point-and-shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: Amy Phipps
Reviews.Content: I'm a mom of 2 and love taking pictures of my kids. I have several point & shoot digital cameras, and the Lumix is as good or better as any I've tried. It takes beautiful, crystal clear photos of outdoor scenery, night or day. Up-close pictures of people - the "smile and say cheese" type - turn out beautifully, too. Photos of running kids across a low-lit gymnasium, on the other hand, are always either grainy or blurry. That's not a problem unique to this camera... my 14.1 MP Sony Cyber-shoot point & shoot, which is pretty comparable in price and specifications to the Lumix, gives pretty much the same results. If you want good low-light action shots, you really need to spring for a more expensive and more bulky SLR digital camera.Anyway, if a point & shoot camera meets your needs, then this is a good one. It's slim, has a bright, beautiful viewing screen, and is easy to operate. It uses a rechargeable battery - an absolute must in my opinion - that charges quickly and gets decent battery life. And it takes a standard SD memory card, so that you can easily and inexpensively expand your memory to fit your needs. Not for all uses, but still recommended for students, tourists, and moms on the go!

Reviews.Title: Small and takes a great snapshot
Reviews.Author: M. Bruner ""Deltareviewer" Real Page ...
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect size to fit in your pocket or small wristlet.  The display is large and clear to view photos.  The camera is easy to operate. I couldn't find the battery at first but was excited to realize that it was rechargeable. Make sure you get a new sd card as you will need it becuase you will love taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome purchase!
Reviews.Author: Agent007
Reviews.Content: This camara is by far better than the Nikon Coolpix and the odak Easyshare I previously had. It's tiny, beautiful, the screen is surprisingly big for such a thin, small camara. The pictures, wow, sharp and crystal clear. It's pretty amazing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent - I love it!
Reviews.Author: Ernest J Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: It is a very easy to use camera and takes great pictures. I use it all the time including work. The auto focus is superb.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Emily H.
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera if all you need is a point and shoot.  It performs best when one is outdoors in the sunlight.  The macro setting isn't great.  If you want to take great macro photos, get a good DSL.  It's good if you are at a reunion or other family event where you need a camera that works and you need to be able to take decent photos of people.  I'm going overseas in the spring and thinking of taking it with me since it won't break the bank if it gets stolen, and it fits easily in a jeans pocket.Downside:  The battery life is so-so.  Take an extra battery with you if you are going to a long event, or be prepared with a plug-in  charger.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Kelly C
Reviews.Content: CAMERA WAS PURCHASED FOR WORK RELATED PHOTO'S.WE HAVE A COLLISION REPAIR BUSINESS AND THE CLARITY OF THE PHOTO'S IS GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Lumix failed to deliver
Reviews.Author: K M "Homeland"
Reviews.Content: I will express here much dissatisfaction from this DMC-FH5 Panasonic Lumix and also from my other Lumix, the FZ40. Both I bought on Amazon. Both failed to do the job they were build to do.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: John Garcia
Reviews.Content: good quality and neat menu. very easy use. battery life is also fine. good for personal home use. family use. nice product for that price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Toni
Reviews.Content: The photos and video that this little came produces is outstanding! Better than my mothers digital SLR camera. She is actually jealous! I do wish the zoom was a little better though and low light videos are extremely grainy, but overall, a GREAT camera! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Franco
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera, it takes beautiful pictures and it's super compact so you can carry it with you very easily.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jehuty101
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my mom and she let me use it when i was living in asia for a few months. i took thousands of pictures. a really great point and shoot camera. very small and sleek as well. the flash worked fine and all the other features were great. i never had any problems with this camera what so ever. i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, dependable camera
Reviews.Author: Larry W. Carnes
Reviews.Content: I bought the violet color version through a military exchange almost a year ago.  No problems, and I'm very happy with its performance.  My only complaint is that in bright sunlight I can't see the LED display without shading it.  Otherwise, it would be 5 STARS all the way.

Reviews.Title: bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: cnagoyer
Reviews.Content: I have a really nice canon but decided to buy my husband a camera of his own so he didnt have to lug my big one around when he wanted to take photos during travelling. Have had it over a year now and still in great shape. Works great and takes good photos too. One of the better digital cameras weve owned and being small with 16.1 MP is awesome. Easy photo tansfer to computer. Easy to figure out camera settings too.

Reviews.Title: Good if you're shooting in good light.
Reviews.Author: CinnamonIcetail
Reviews.Content: This camera's pretty good, but does not shoot well in low light, and the macro does not have a very good depth of field. For the amateur photographer that's just looking for a decent but inexpensive camera, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: I adore this camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Risinger
Reviews.Content: After much thought and research I decided to go with this camera and I'm so glad I did! Light weight and takes GREAT pics!

Reviews.Title: Black spots in all images after a few months, warranty a joke!
Reviews.Author: W. Rothrum
Reviews.Content: After just a 4-6 months of using the camera there were black spots in images, that got bigger with zoom. Likely dust on an inner lens due to an ineffective seal, they'd move around sometimes.Amazon wouldn't replace it and gave me contact info for Panasonic. After spending copious time on hold and completing a warranty return, I sent the camera back. A few weeks later I received a replacement, to my surprise that is an FH6 and  NOT the FH5 that I sent them. Yes, I sent them a camera valued at $179, they returned one valued at $89. It's cheap feeling, plastic, not of the same build quality and lacking the same features.After speaking with Panasonic, they've given me the option to send it back (again!) and they'll see what they have that they can send me, but it will NOT be an FH5 like I originally returned. I'm more than a little concerned about being without a camera for Christmas.After spending hours researching cameras, then dealing with spots in important family pictures, then spending hours on hold and paying out of pocket to send the camera back, then waiting with NO camera to take pictures at THREE birthdays, now asking me to send it back and be without a camera AGAIN.... You'd think Panasonic would UPGRADE a customer for the inconvenience, or at the very least, send the same model back! If this is resolved in a sensible, fair manner, I'll gladly update this review. As it stands, I cannot recommend anyone purchase a Panasonic product.

Reviews.Title: Dustcatcher
Reviews.Author: Rsquare
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this camera is small, easy-to-use and takes great pictures.  I bought it primarily to have a wide-angle lens for interior shots, but I was so delighted with my results that it quickly became my pants-pocket camera for carrying around, so that I would always have a camera available (since I do not use a cellphone).  This turned out to be a big mistake.  The camera is not well sealed, and pants-pocket lint quickly worked its way onto the CCD, leaving spots on every picture.  I thought that some of this was due to the fact that the lens opened up inside my pocket a few times when the on switch got bumped, so I bought a second one and set it on playback, so that no accidental activation of the on switch could result in the lens opening.  Same result, dust on the CCD.  I tried several ways to clean the cameras, like blowing air into the open lens and shaking them, but nothing helped.Thankfully, Panasonic treated both cameras as warranty repairs (both were less than a year old) and sent me reconditioned cameras with clean CCDs.  I gave one away, and the other is still my pocket camera, but now in an inexpensive Vivitar semi-hard shell case, which should prevent it from getting turned on accidentally.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: It is a great little camera, which is what I wanted!! It takes really good pictures, it is easy to operate, it is easy to carry around, and it has alot of options for a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: markrine
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year now and it works reasonably well. I had an old Kodak w/ 3MP that finally gave up the ghost. Got this one. Fits well in my pocket. Takes reasonably good photos, but not great ones, even on max MP. Not even as good as my old Kodak, but it's a handy camera and works well for a tag a long pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay.
Reviews.Author: Addicted to Mountains
Reviews.Content: I used to have a somewhat larger Lumix that I lost.  I would have happily bought the same camera again, but they don't sell it anymore.  This one does okay except that the pictures are not nearly as well focused as the older version that I used to like so much.

Reviews.Title: Grainy photos with no detail.
Reviews.Author: L. Williams "Gnosisless"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I own a Canon DSLR and have owned several Canon, Sony, and Kodak point and shoot cameras.  This 16MP Panasonic Lumix produces low-quality photos on a par with a Kodak I had nearly 10 years ago.  I suspect it's a build problem and something's just wrong with the unit I received.  There are far too many good reviews for it to be the camera design alone.  Nevertheless, there are also plenty of reviews commenting on bad photo quality.  Conclusion:  probably a manufacturing defect of some kind.Pros:*small and easy to carry*easy to turn the flash on and off*most settings are only a couple of menu selections away*Battery life actually seems pretty good for a camera this smallCons:*picture quality is horrible.  Grainy photos at any ISO setting, even with the flash and in good lighting.  The only decent photos I could get were 10ft or less in bright sunlight.So, my opinion:  if you get one of the non-defective ones, you'll probably be pretty happy with this camera for quick vacation/party/camping photos.  Otherwise, you'll be returning it like I did.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: excellent..
Reviews.Content: I liked the product was what I expected and very good quality to recommend them all very good product when I can come back to buy

Reviews.Title: First Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Elbert
Reviews.Content: In that this is my first point and shoot, I don't have antything to really compare this camera with.  I have other cameras, however.  I read the reviews on the Panasonic and felt that for the money it was worth a try.(16.1 MP!)  I am accustomed to printing my pictures.  Those printed using the Panasonic are far less than desirable for me; grainy.  They look alright in the camera if that's the only record you are looking for.I guess for the money, I didn't make a big mistake.  But, if I had a way to try before I buy, I would not have bought!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH5 camera
Reviews.Author: M. Gray "Consumer"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera for non-technical people. I got one for my mother-in-law, whose older camera went kaput. She is not tech-savvy, and I worried about how long it would take for her to learn to use a new one. She was up and using it in no time, and her husband, who NEVER used the old one, even started using this one. It worked so well that I even got one for my own mother. My mother had always refused to use her prior digital camera, but has been taking this one out with her and actually using it. She loves the small size and light weight.Overall, this is a basic digital camera. It is small, and doesn't have a lot of controls cluttering it. Its operation is simple and intuitive, and it takes very good photos without a lot of fussing. I highly recommend it for anyone wanting a basic point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: fun fun fun
Reviews.Author: keith roberts
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera and I couldn't be more pleased.  Very easy to use and so small yet so power packed.  I recommend it to anyone in its price range.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a pocket-sized point and shoot
Reviews.Author: T. Burchwell "tigger79"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just had a beautiful baby girl.  We wanted a small point and shoot camera that we could carry easily in a pocket or purse, that takes good pictures. This fits the bill perfectly. The pictures look great, there are several scene options, and the video quality is good. We are by no means profeesional; just everyday people who love taking pictures.My favorite feature is probably the ability to save my child's name and birthdate so the name and age show up when I use the baby scene mode.  The same applies to our dog and pet scene mode.The great price was definitely a selling point, along with the great reviews this one got.  I also checked it out on cnet before buying, and they gave it good reviews too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: jcarlomb
Reviews.Content: A small camera that takes big quality pictures. Very easy to set up and use. I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian ORourke
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a previous Lumix which was given away as a gift.  I thought this camera was going to be bigger like my old one, but I am very impressed with it.  It is smaller, so it's easier to handle, the pictures are very good, it's easy to use and I have no complaints at all.  For the price I paid for this camera, I don't think I could have done better purchasing a higher end camera.  I would recommend this to anyone who is not a photographer by trade!

Reviews.Title: Big things come in tiny packages
Reviews.Author: Tracy Vest
Reviews.Content: Being such a compact camera, I really did not expect much, but was pleasantly surprised at the quality and clarity of the digital pictures.  It is easy to juice up and get ready - just need to charge the battery; and downloading is a snap.  It is so light - and easily transportable.I just wish it had the option for batteries rather than an A/C charger. I know, bad for the environment, but when I travel outside the US, finding enough adaptors for my gear is difficult.  But that did not preclude me from purchasing a second one as a gift for my sister.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for General Use (Traveling, fun, etc)
Reviews.Author: Jimbo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with only 3 days before going on a trip to china. Friend recommended it based on reviews online and it's turned out to be a great general camera for all your needs. I'm not a fancy camera user, but I am active and enjoy spur of the moment shots and action shots, food shots, etc. It has provided good quality photos and other fun "scene" modes for the general user. Good load time, quality photos, and functionality. I've used fujifilm in the past and had no problems, and this camera is also good quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Marc Cram "Vegas Monkey"
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera .. but its a mixed bag.On the good side, it's small, light and tightly built. The LCD panels is pretty clear and bright. The on/off switch is solid. The menu system is simple to use. The sixteen mp is great. In full sunlight this camera rocks. The video quality is alright .. adequate. The price is very good considering the features. The flash is actually really good for the size - few over-exposed spots and not much red-eye.The bad side. Autofocus takes quite a bit of time and if you're not careful you get fuzzy pictures. The low-light is just horrible. This camera really stumbles taking pictures in low-light situations without a flash. Let me put it this way, you have to use the flash .. it's required.All-in-all the camera suits my purposes, a small easy-to-us camera that I can take anywhere and my family can use. It compliments my Canon T2i quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Em Ay "MAN"
Reviews.Content: Have had a Lumix in the past & passed it to our son.  We love all the features of the new one as much as the old one.  Easy to use, very good value, received in a timely manner in good condition, & would not hesitate to recommend this product offered by Amazon to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: A Picture is worth thousand words.  How about an Album?
Reviews.Author: Chandra Sekhar
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur "point and shoot" camera guy whose pictures are mostly cell phone (Galaxy 4G),  5MP Sony Cybershot , Still photos from a videocamera  (Sony CX 150). It fits my requirment since my realm of photography is limited to Kids and family.  So if you fit in my profile, this review should be useful to you.PROS:First the camera picture quality is excellent. The camera is tiny and easy to handle.Decent zoom that is differentiates over the cell phone cameras.16 Mega Pixels is like a palatial luxury for me and some of the pictures are uploaded for your review. I have paid special attention to have the pictures from a gloomy day, inside the home etc. picasaweb dot google dot com forwardslash coolchandra forwardslash PicturesTakenFromPanasonicDMCFH5Camera#CONS:The picture are good,but some of the night pictures have a dark edges, something that is the limitation of these type of point and shoot camera. The external memory card is a must as internal memory covers 12-13 pictures.FULL DISCLOSURE : I received this camera for free under the vine program,but the review is not influenced by it. Please browse through other reviews of mine.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic compact camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Trovato
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for travelling and quick pictures. I am getting ready to study abroad for the next three years and my boyfriend who will be with me has a great DSLR. I was looking for a compact point and shoot with great features that would take nice pictures I could share with my family to help them experience what I was seeing while abroad. We did a lot of research and decided that the Panasonic cameras had the best features and lenses for the price. The panasonic cameras are not nearly as popular as Nikon and Canon, but the Leica lenses are in my opinion better for the price than others.A week after I bought the camera I went on a trip with some friends. I was able to take great pictures both inside and out with little fuss which was perfect. I didn't have the weight and bulk of a large camera, but my pictures came out just as nice as some of the pictures that were taken with a more expensive large cameras.I am extremely pleased with this camera and my boyfriend and I have decided it will be a great camera to use for photo blogging our adventures abroad.

Reviews.Title: This is easy!!
Reviews.Author: Vikki Hallen "lizardwitch"
Reviews.Content: I already have a digital, but this one makes mine seem like an antique! Unbelievable size, takes up no room at all in my purse.  The greatest thing for me is the ease of pic taking.."intelligent mode".  Camera determines best shot.  All of the instructions are very clear on the instruction disc though it did take a bit of time to download.  I need an external card so I can have more than 12 shots at a time. Other than that..it's absolutely simple to use and I'm no techie so that's what I'm looking for!  Also, I like the screen size and the fact that it comes already to load to Fb and YouTube! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Danielle A. Russo "Dani hearts books"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I take a lot of pictures of my animals and need something that doesn't pause. Great pictures, great settings.  I'm so glad I bought this. It was a replacement for the coolpix camera I had - this one is SO much better!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, but not the best pictures
Reviews.Author: Natalie Jane "J"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is a bit dull (especially compared to my previous camera, a Pentax Optio) and grainy, even with 14MP.  Performs best indoors.

Reviews.Title: Takes nice, clear, crisp pics.............5 stars for this
Reviews.Author: McCarth "aka sLiM sHaDy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome and I highly recommend it!! It is so compact and so light weight and takes such beautiful clear, crisp pictures. The LCD screen is nice and big too. I can't even tell you how fast this camera takes a picture. You click the button once and boom the pic is taken instantly. Unlike some other digital cameras I have owned in the past where you have to literally hold the button down for like 10 seconds or so and even then, the camera seems to take so long to adjust and focus or what not. Not with this one. This is totally worth the money, buy it, you won't be disappointed. I just love it!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Countrygal
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our son for his birthday.  He loves it.  It's just the right size and the right color for him.  The pics are amazing.  It's quick and accurate.

Reviews.Title: Grainy photos!!
Reviews.Author: A. Isaksson "pippi_longstocking"
Reviews.Content: I am quite disappointed by this point-and-shoot camera. I used an 'old' Canon A80 previously, but it broke, so i thought i'd upgrade to this Leica-lensed Panasonic. Haha!  Not so. Pictures are SUPER grainy with this camera, unless you always use flash.Sure, one does need light when shooting indoors, but even in daylight, faces come out orange-blotchy and grainy!! No joke! Focus is not good either!!! A decent camera should be able to process daylight pics without flash. I take the same 'style' of photos with this Panasonic as i did with my old Canon, but the quality is not even close. I am not a bad photographer, but if i DO use flash, it is so strong, that everything gets blown out; I have to turn it waaay down.I will buy Canon again soon. I suggest you others do the same. Honestly.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: ronw
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use & so compact that it works perfectly for my needs. I love it.

Reviews.Title: vacationer
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on vacation.  It was easy to use and took great pictures.  It was small enough to slip into a pocket or handbag.

Reviews.Title: venezuela11
Reviews.Author: venezuela11
Reviews.Content: justo lo que esperaba, cumplió con mis expectativas, recomendado para personas que como yo queremos fotos y videos de buena calidad sin tantas complicaciones; la calidad de vídeo es muy buena. Un punto a favor es que trae pila recargable.

Reviews.Title: I expected more
Reviews.Author: Natalya
Reviews.Content: the camera is easy to use and holds a great charge. but the pictures taken are never sharp. 16 mp seems more like 8.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera. One small problem
Reviews.Author: Joseph Peren
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.The packaging is really small but I guess the camera is well secured inside.It came with all the necessary manuals etc. I would have loved to see an SD card inside. Even if it was just a 1~2gb card. Fortunately however the unit did come with an internal memory.The camera works well.The only issue i had with this is during it's initial startup.I unwrap the camera and turned it on. The lense came out and I observed it. I noticed that there was a huge smudge on the lens. It's like someone with greasy fingers touched it. I went and got a lens cleaner and it came right off. No problems since then.I guess the only thing that ticked me off was that someone at the factory decided to eat some french fries or something before turning it off and packing it.

Reviews.Title: good!!!
Reviews.Author: Aylin
Reviews.Content: a very good camera with cute accessories, the only thing I did not like was that the box arrived quite tired, but then the camera on the maximum....!!

Reviews.Title: Good Housekeeping Says...
Reviews.Author: theYoungs
Reviews.Content: Good Housekeeping rated this camera best picture and video quality for the price, 2,000 plus tests can't be wrong...right? I think I'll try it!

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I've ever had.
Reviews.Author: ja2kattack
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed by this camera and don't know why it got such high ratings. I bought it to use for my birthday and it totally failed on me. Even after trying all the different settings, the picture quality was horrible. It was very grainy and the pictures often came out blurry. The tones were very orange and it was the worst camera to use in night or indoor settings. Save your money and don't get this camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
16.1-megapixel resolution
4x optical zoom; 28mm wide-angle Leica lens
720 HD video capture; LUMIX Image Uploader makes it simple to share pictures on Facebook and video on YouTube
Panasonic iA mode makes it simple for anyone to take beautiful photos
Capture images and video to  SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH5 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
